title: Myanmar–Taiwan relations
text:
Myanmar–Taiwan relations refers to the <a href="international%20relations">international relations</a> between <a href="Myanmar">Myanmar</a> and the <a href="Republic%20of%20China">Republic of China</a>. There are no official relations between the two countries, as Myanmar only recognizes the <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">People's Republic of China</a>.
History.
In 1949, following the end of the <a href="Chinese%20Civil%20War">Chinese Civil War</a>, some <a href="Kuomintang">Kuomintang</a> soldiers fled and took a stronghold in Northern <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a> and <a href="Myanmar">Myanmar</a> with support from the US. With support from the PRC, Myanmar accused the Republic of China of "invading" Myanmar, and issued an appeal to the <a href="United%20Nations">United Nations</a>. After many negotiations, all Kuomintang soldiers in Myanmar were sent to Northern Thailand. Kuomintang soldiers helped Thailand fight <a href="communist">communist</a> rebels, and prevented a left revolution in Thailand, which led to the <a href="King%20of%20Thailand">King of Thailand</a>, <a href="Bhumibol%20Adulyadej">Bhumibol Adulyadej</a>, giving Kuomintang soldiers special amnesty for entitlement in Thailand, whilst some left for <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>.
Diplomatic representation.
In the absence of formal diplomatic relations, Myanmar has a mission in <a href="Taipei">Taipei</a> known as the <a href="Myanmar%20Trade%20Office%2C%20the%20Republic%20of%20the%20Union%20of%20Myanmar">Myanmar Trade Office, the Republic of the Union of Myanmar</a>. Operated by the country's <a href="Ministry%20of%20Commerce%20%28Myanmar%29">Ministry of Commerce</a>, this was established in June 2015. Taiwan currently has no mission in <a href="Naypyidaw">Naypyidaw</a>, with Myanmar affairs being handled by the <a href="Taipei%20Economic%20and%20Cultural%20Office%20in%20Thailand">Taipei Economic and Cultural Office</a> in <a href="Bangkok">Bangkok</a>, <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a>. However, the <a href="Taiwan%20External%20Trade%20Development%20Council">Taiwan External Trade Development Council</a> established a trade mission in <a href="Yangon">Yangon</a> in November 2013.
Economic.
Agriculture.
Taiwan-based "Known-You Seed Corporation" established in 1968, moved into the Myanmar market in 1994. In 1996, it began to cooperate with the Ministry of Agriculture & Irrigation of Myanmar, which founded an agricultural school in Irrawaddy. The most frequently imported product is <a href="watermelon">watermelon</a>.
Transportation.
<a href="China%20Airlines">China Airlines</a> offers flights from <a href="Taiwan%20Taoyuan%20International%20Airport">Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport</a> to <a href="Yangon%20International%20Airport">Yangon International Airport</a>.
